thread.title: Tesla’s huge stock move pushes its market cap closer to Ford’s, GM’s - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: Tesla’s huge stock move pushes its market cap closer to Ford’s, GM’s - MarketWatch

author: Claudia Assis
title: Tesla’s huge stock move pushes its market cap closer to Ford’s, GM’s - MarketWatch
text:
Tesla Inc. stock gains have pushed the company’s market capitalization very close to the value of Ford Motor Co. and General Motors Co.
Tesla TSLA, -0.67% shares have gained 50% since early December, compared with a 4% gain for the S&P 500 index. SPX, -0.06%
That move has catapulted Tesla’s market cap to nearly $45 billion. That compares with nearly $50 billion for Ford F, +0.28% and, farther off, about $57 billion for GM GM, +0.18% according to FactSet.
See also: Tesla earnings: Expect Model 3 updates
Analysts polled by FactSet expect 2017 sales of more than $142 billion for Ford and more than $164 billion for GM. Tesla’s sales for the year are seen around $7 billion.
The stock also beats the S&P 500 benchmark in the last 12 months, up 54% to the index’s 21%, and in pretty much any other time period one cares to slice -- with the exception of the weeks leading up to the U.S. presidential election and shortly after.
The stock started its march upward as investors seemed to worry less and less that Tesla, as a clean-energy company and electric-car maker, would suffer under a Donald Trump administration.
Here’s what the comparison between the S&P 500 and Tesla looks like since the election:
And here’s how Ford and GM shares have done since the election, compared with Tesla stock:
Musk is a member of the president’s economic advisory council even though the Tesla CEO has tried to distance himself from the administration.
Related: Tesla worker not on ‘union payroll,’ UAW says
All eyes are on the Model 3, the mass-market car Tesla hopes to sell by the end of this year. Tesla has set a goal to ramp up production to a rate of half a million cars in 2018, an ambitious plan that largely hinges on the success of the Model 3.
Tesla is scheduled to report fourth-quarter earnings after the bell Wednesday , with Wall Street eager to hear updates about Model 3 production.
Related: Tesla earnings: Expect Model 3 updates amid record stock highs
Will Musk/Trump bromance boost Tesla? (0:39) CEO Elon Musk and President Trump seem to be hitting it off; some say Tesla Motors could become a defense contractor.
